title: Complementary and Alternative Medicines Defined
description: The AAAAI defines Complementary and Alternative Medicines CAM) as a group of health care practices (yoga) and products that are not typically considered part of conventional medical practice.
cleaned_text: Complementary and Alternative Medicines Defined CAM refers to a group of health care practices and products that are not typically considered part of conventional medical practice. "Complementary" references the use of a complementary practice combined with conventional health care. "Alternative medicine" refers to use of CAM without conventional health care practices. For instance, combining yoga into a conventional [asthma action plan](/Aaaai/media/Media-Library-PDFs/Tools%20for%20the%20Public/Allergy,%20Asthma,%20Immunology%20Glossary/NEW-WEBSITE-LOGO-asthma-action-plan_HI.pdf) for control of asthma symptoms is considered complementary. There currently are no scientifically proven alternative medicines for the treatment of allergies and asthma. [Learn more](/Aaaai/media/Media-Library-PDFs/Tools%20for%20the%20Public/Allergy,%20Asthma,%20Immunology%20Glossary/EL-Reactions-to-CAM-patient.pdf) about CAM related to allergies and asthma.
